Getting a COVID-19 Vaccine

Tennessee health care providers are now administering COVID-19 vaccinations to Tennesseans as outlined in ourÂ COVID-19 Vaccination Plan. Tennesseeâs phased approach to administering COVID-19 vaccines prioritizes those most at risk of illness and death from COVID-19. This page provides information on how Tennesseans may receive a COVID-19 vaccination.

Tennesseans will be eligible to receive a COVID-19 vaccination by the phase in which they fall. Categories included in the phases of Tennesseeâs vaccination plan are as follows:

Phase 1a1 Phase 1a2 Phase 1b Phase 1c Phase 2 Phase 3

Inpatient health care workers

 All other health care workers School and child care facility workers

People age 16 and older who have high-risk health conditions

 Critical infrastructure workers People in congregate living facilities
Other health care workers with high-risk exposure to COVID-19 Funeral home and mortuary service workers First responder agency administrative service workers Â  Â  Grocery store workers
Residents and staff members of long-term health care facilities Â  Â  Â  Â  People in correctional facilities
First responders Â  Â  Â  Â  Â 
People age 18 and over who are not able to live independently due to health care conditions or developmental or intellectual disability Â  Â  Â  Â  Â 

For more details of each category, go toÂ www.tn.gov/content/dam/tn/health/documents/cedep/novel-coronavirus/COVID-19_Vaccination_Plan.pdf.

Â 

Age-based Vaccination for COVID-19

Tennessee is vaccinating anyone aged 70 and older, no matter what phase they may fall in, as they are at highest risk for serious illness, hospitalization and death from COVID-19. Your county health department may be booking appointments to provide COVID-19 vaccinations to people age 70 and older. Learn how to contact your county health department and book your appointmentÂ here.

How Do I Get a COVID-19 Vaccination When Itâs My Phase?Â 

Tennessee counties will move through the phases of the COVID-19 Vaccination Plan at different times, based on the availability of vaccines. People qualifying for vaccination may be offered vaccine by their employer, through their local health department or through a partnering hospital. Your county health department may be booking appointments to provide COVID-19 vaccinations when itâs your phase. Learn what phase your county is in and how to book your appointmentÂ Â here.
